data.text: This is an interesting post. About the only time I don't use a bell: On the road touring, of course there are exceptions to every rule. I've used various bells since '88 when part of my commute was on the Burke-Gillman trail winding its way through Seattle. I did a test of voice, bell, horn Horn definitely got negative attention. Voice: Morning/afternoon/nice day whatever was appropriate, good responses from those that could hear The bell gets a variety of responses. It must be loud enough to get attention of the hearing. To be effective any alert system should be employed prior to reaching your 'target audience'. IF someone has ears plugged, I still announce but aware they maybe shocked & react poorly when I finally pass. Being safe is on the responsibilty of the driver. On the trails, its us. Stay safe & have fun.
